intro: Rungia diversibracteata, commonly known as the broad-bract rungia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many ornamental and economically important species. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers with prominent bracts. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
